Message.Title: Obama wants American taxpayers to pay for food stamps in Mexico
Message.Msg: Fat And Furious: Obama Pushes Food Stamps In Mexico (source investors dot com) Welfare: As if being "food stamp president" weren't enough, Barack Obama's administration is partnering with the Mexican government to make sure Mexican nationals living in the U.S. don't miss out. On Wednesday, Sen. Jeff Sessions, R-Ala., who's been pushing for reform of the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), commonly known as food stamps, sent a letter to Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack asking for details of our partnership agreement with Mexico to promote food stamp use, including whether we are looking the other way in cases of illegal aliens. To Obama, increasing our national debt to $16 trillion is not enough.

Message.Title: Quite obvious
Message.Msg: Yahoo is only worth its liquidation value. Even the oriental assets value is overstated.

Partner, you need to take a deeper look at Alibaba! Asian experts expect the IPO to be the largest ever in the world. Read the news and learn the extent of Alibaba's penetration into markets in Asia. From insurance to personals, they are moving into every aspect of internet commerce. The IPO will be valued at close to 150B and YHOO will still own 20% of that. YHOO's Japan assets are valued at exactly the market since it is a public company, which, by the way, is growing profits at a fast clip!. Tell me please why you think the value of the "oriental" assets are overstated? Buy YHOO now or wish like H^ll you had done so three months from now.

Message.Title: Marissa Effect
Message.Msg: She said revised plan to distribute $4Billions to shareholders- the stock tanked 10% from $16.35 to $14.70 Let's see if she is worthy being a CEO in driving up the value of the company before delivery in October.

Fools ignore the value of Yahoo core -- a portal that hundreds of millions use everyday. One of the biggest billboards on the net -- Yahoo.com is the top ten website in almost 30 countries around the world
Still 2 years 3 months later great business and lots of fun.

At $17.20 Yahoo is fully valued. Those of you who have been around for a year know that I worked out the numbers when the LBO guys were kicking the tires. What happened? Their bids came in around my $17.20. Now here is an idea for you. Do the math yourself. Pull out the tax codes. Figure the repatriation taxes. Use US dollars not Hong Kong dollars. Just do the math yourself. Unfortunately, Dan Loeb is discovering what Eric Jackson and Carl Icahn have already learned. When you buy into the Yahoo dream, the dream chews you up and spits you out after having taken a good portion of your capital. Every day, Eddie Lampert gets up and thanks his god that he invested in Sears rather than Yahoo.
